page.title: 04 Minor Roads.
page.content:
Although much work and money has been spent in widening and straightening the busier main roads, the minor country roads which serve the{villages in this area are typical. Junctions and dangerous corners are marked with signs and white paint, but there are no rows of{"cats'-eyes"}to show the middle of the road width. These reflect the lights of cars at night like the eyes of a cat that glow.
There are many places where it is difficult for two cars to pass each other and entrances to{houses}and {factories}are often extra wide to make it less dangerous to pull in or out of the driveways.
There is less{street lighting}except where there are villages and grass at roadsides is not cut as on main roads.
